div.font:
Update status when joining/leaving a call
PUT /api/person/:person_id

switch.text: Update status when joining/leaving a call...

div.font:
Publish heartbeat to $HEARTBEAT_TOPIC
(from fetched MQTT metadata)

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 430px; margin-left: 605px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
* Polling only takes place if any recent-enough
heartbeats exist from ESP32 device(s).
This is helpful to avoid burn through excessive
Heroku free dyno hours by polling for updates
when no ESP-32 devices are even listening for
updates…

switch.text: * Polling only takes place if any recent-en...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 400px; margin-left: 2px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

ul.li: Should be one or the other, not both.
Otherwise, not quite as "dynamic" as it could be
Introduce some kind of control topics
i.e. allow MQTT broker to signal consumers to reboot, etc.

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
